The anime universe is also reasonably well done even though it is not as exploited. KonoSuba's great achievement is not to keep up with forced comedy out of thin air at all times and also not get the same jokes done. An example I can give here is the comedy anime Grand Blue that gets the 12 episodes making fun of drinks and nakedpeople. Another hit from KonoSuba is that he has a focus and keeps it from start to finish: show youngsters on a survival adventure in a magical world.


Animation is very pretty reminding much the American cartoons with their colors very lively and cheerful. The fight scenes are very well done and contain a very smooth animation.


The soundtrack is not very striking or memorable, but if you take the proposal of the story that is not enough to be an anime error. anime horror, suspense, drama, romance and the like always ask a good soundtrack to compose his narrative and Konasuba not apply to any of these cases.


The only flaw of the anime is that it seems like it walks, walks, walks ... but it never leaves the place. Yes they have many adventures that vary during the course of the work, but we never really see an evolution. You can ask "but you just said that he does not keep repeating the same jokes", yes I actually said that, but in this case I am only taking into account THE COMEDY of the anime, here I am considering the plot with a whole and it is in this point where just the anime fails! The story advances, advances, advances ... but when we see it is back in the same place. This season is not a problem but the following season affects the performance of the anime a lot.

So I recently finished Konosuba and honestly, I'm not sure what to think about it. 
Basically, it's an anime set in a RPG like world with levels and skills and all those geeky terminology that only a handful of people will know. I will give props to the show on it's aesthetics, but comparing the look to the actual content is pretty unfair the way I see it. I say this because honestly, nothing really major happens in the show and each episode feels more like it's own stand alone thing than a chronological series of events. 
Nothing issue I had with the anime wasthe jokes that was kinda it's main selling point. Not saying the jokes were bad, but they did start to get repetitive after sometime making it obvious where the plot of any particular episode was going. This happens because the characters are basically one trick ponies when it comes to personality where at some points I actually forgot their names and actually knew them as "Protagonist", "Useless Goddess", "explosive Witch", and "Masochistic Knight". \n\n
I feel like the show does a good job with their comedy, which I won't say is a bad thing, but it kinda just introduces you to a character, shows you their quirks, and have you laugh at them without anything new being added to the character. Sure there may be a conflict or two they face, but by the end of the episode it's almost like it never existed and come next episode it's almost like it completely forgotten that it ever happened. \n\n
I can't really fault the show on what it is, because I will admit it's entertaining, but it's nothing I think should be praised as a masterpiece for what it is. Basically, watch it if you want a good laugh, not a good story.

If you're look for a serious anime look elsewhere, but if you like fun and like to be entertained then this is for you.
This is adventure anime dissection in a over the top joke kind of way, people who compare this to SOA are seriously lost because this anime doesn't take itself too seriously its all laughs and giggles.
That's not to say this anime is perfect though nothing is, there isn't much character growth between themselves or each other, at times you think the overall arc is going no where, but this anime is just so funny and the characters are so lovable you putthose concerns on the back burner for now.\n\n
If you liked One Punch Man, I think you should like this too but keep in mind this is far more sillier than OPM.\n

This review is based solely on first season of anime, with no knowledge about source material.
At first glance, Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!, or KonoSuba for short, looks like most generic comedy harems with "average at everything" protagonist... but it's much more than that. In this review I'll focus mostly on explaining why.
Story:
Random-nobody boy ends up in different world for whatever reason. Nothing special, right? But what if the reason he got transported to this other world was already funnier than most comedy anime out there?
Let's be honest. KonoSuba is comedy, not epic story about heroes and their struggles. Its world is very basic"RPG like world with demon king and adventurers", which, while seemingly boring and overused, goes perfectly with lighthearted atmosphere of the story. That lightheartedness is the strongest point of the story - even when things seemed to get serious, this anime managed to make me laugh.\n\n
Art/Sound:\n
While colours, lines, and effects are nice, they aren't anything exceptional. Same goes for music. What makes up for them are perfectly fitting voice acting and characters expressions - especially ones going with all kinds of disgust, pity and such. Kazuma's glances alone made me laugh many times, even before he said what he thought.\n\n
Characters:\n
Now, this is where KonoSuba excels. Every character is unique and awesome. They all have their quirks and can be funny and annoying at the same time. \n
You won't see tsundere childhood friend or cute imouto (not that I'd mind...) here. \n
What you get instead is dumb as hell goddess who is so full of herself you want to kill her but at the same time cute enough that you can't really hate her, or maniacal mage girl who lives for sole burposes of blowing things up. And what about extreme M blonde who can't actually do anything else than taking hits?\n
And then there is Kazuma himself. If you expect another dense harem MC, then go other way. This one, while being standard shut-in highschooler, is far from usual dense protagonist. He understands his situation, knows what he wants and doesn't hesitate to use tricks to move forward. Can be nice, but also mean and sarcastic.\n\n
Enjoyment:\n
The facts that I rewatched KonoSuba mere 3 monhts after watching it for the first time speaks for itself. While short and not too deep, this anime manages to keep one interested all the time, and you don't even notice when you clicked to watch next episode.

Before watching Kono Subarashii my life was shit. Then a light appeared in the sky, showing me the true meaning of life and happiness. That light was Kono Subarashii.
I think some people won't be able to understand the true greatness of this masterpiece; especially if they're originated from the Jugge area, or if they're currently residing near a convenience store around Verkstadstorgetu. These people are of course known as Retard-san.
After watching this beautiful embodiment of a visual orgasm, all my problems in life are gone; because it has shown me that even mondaine charachters with equally mondaine lives can find happiness.
9/10 (Not Perfect, because ofthe fact that I'll die of age before I'll be able to watch it enough)

SPOILER FREE REVIEW
This review covers the 22 episodes of Konosuba (2 seasons and 2 OVAS) since both seasons are in every aspect identical (though the drop in the animation quality seems pretty notable to me in the second season).
Konosuba is for a lot of people a very hard anime to review simply because there is no secret formula to review comedy series and because not everybody in the planet shares the same sense of humor but i'm not one of those guys, Konosuba is not as innocent as it seems ergo it should be ready to receive harder hits due to it's own nature, thesynopsis and the genre labels are not wrong but they are not complete either, what the synopsis and the genre labels forget to mention is that the fanservice amount in this series is HUGE and that part is extremely important.


Konosuba is another one of those animes that belong to the INSANELY famous/infamous "Isekai"sub-genre and to my eyes Konosuba brings absolutely nothing new to the table, i have to mention i'm not a well versed person in this sub-genre at all and even i can tell this show is nothing special.


Recently i've seen fans of this show saying Konosuba is a better choice than other Isekai animes because it explores a "whole new perspective" that hasn't been touched ever, hell, i've even read several comments of people that to go as far as saying this anime is a deconstruction, they say the idea of a show where the protagonist travels to a whole new world and he actually choses to stay and struggle instead of trying desperately to find his way out is as revolutionary as Utena, but sadly this is false, the same idea was explored in No Game No Life and the concept was touched superficially in nothing more and nothing less than SAO so i don't know exactly where such idea came from.


To keep this review short ill say this show uses the exact same formula over and over and over again, the jokes are basically always the same, since they grow from the same roots it would be dumb to expect otherwise, these roots are the unidimensional characters, we have the dumb and almost useless goddess who always ruins everything, the EXTREMELY pervert and masochist paladin, the nini-hikikomori protagonist (who is also insanely pervert) and the crazy girl with a cronic addiction to sniffing C4 that also enjoys giving weird names to everything she founds, what the hell? Chunchunmaru and Chomosuke? lol


Moving out to the technical section, well... i try not to be superficial and to not judge a book by it's cover but the music is forgettable, the character desing is generic and simplistic for at least all of the secondary characters and the animation is TERRIBLE but since the animation part seems to be on purpouse i'll leave to you to be the judge and deliberate if that is good or bad. Does that animation and character desing improve the comical aspect of the series? it's up to you and only you pal.


The real and honest reason a lot people actually started watching Konosuba is nothing more and nothing less that... oh yeah buddy you know that, say it with me, don't be shy ¡¡¡THE DELICIOUS NUTRUTIOUS FANSERVICE!!! ¡¡¡YEAH BOIIIII!!! back in 2016 anime forums and Facebook groups were filled to the top with pictures of Aqua going commando and GIFS of this anime and his... particular jiggle physics, well Konosuba is not the only sinner who caught adepts by using this metod, another insanely popular anime this year did exactly the same thing, getting massive for having a very "complex plot", i'm talking to you Mr. Kobayashi, the point here is that showing some skin really helps to become massive (lol) and that point is one of the main reasons i judge this anime much more seriously, well we also have the fact that some villians are supossed to be though guys but end up being pathethic cartoons and that the world is insanely small, everything spins around the main 4 since nobody outside of them achives nothing special.


Watch this anime if you like: NGNL, SAO, Overlord, Mondaiji tachi, etc.


Don't watch this if you look for alternative experiences when it comes to animation, you are gonna get dissapointed.

Kono Suba is a brilliant show that manages to have a semi episodic style all the while building on jokes told in previous episodes. Although like previously stated it is mainly episodic it still manages to push the plot forward however so slightly.
Pros:
-massive entertainment value 
-the whole show is a satire of isekai shows (Transported to Another World Anime's)
-the characters alone are good but their interactions are great and feel believable 
-the show as a whole is surprisingly very nuanced 
Cons:
-theres an off chance this isn't your kind of humor 
-Although the story does have plot some nice plot points it's not very compelling norintricate \n\n
Sound: \n
The op and ed are both good but what really stands out is the OST that help make the show feel more vibrant and vivid. The best thing about them is that many are over dramatic and over the top which add comedic value.\n\n
Art:\n
The art looks good but isn't anything out of the to out of the ordinary, but it does do a good job at making it feel like a fantasy world.\n\n
Characters:\n
The main cast of characters all have an extreme personality (the exception maybe being the main character), yet still feel very real.\n\n

Kono Suba, an anime I watch and enjoyed. I liked this anime because of the great comedic value. It had me laughing with all the nonsense going on. It even made my friend laugh when we watched it together. The art is great and I found it cute. If you came for the "plot" (if you know what I mean), you've gotten what you wanted. All these elements together with its over-the-top comedic humor and right timing, this anime is sure to charm its way into your kokoro somehow.
For those of you who are taking a break from watching anime that makes you feel, I'dsay that you should watch this and it'll lift your spirits!.

My second review and it's for my favourite anime so far for this year, KonoSuba. 
Note : It maybe a bit (or much) spoiler 
Story (8/10)
The story was generic, but in many way, that was great. Kazuma (protagonist) die, meet Aqua, reborn with Aqua to the new world he never see before. But hey, they give the story so much comedic scene, with a giant toad, cabbage, and dullahan. I'm always think "isekai" anime was so serious with many action and much drama, but hey this anime was so fresh with that comedy and Kazuma's words.
Art (6/10)
The art ... not good, but not bad too.Inconsistent and so far inferior than many new anime, but it become a trade mark, with much variety expression


Sound (9/10)


I love the sound. BGM, OP, ED. Not perfect, but so fit with this anime. Especially with that ED song, i love it so much and think it as "one of the greatest ending song for anime ever"


Character (10/10)


You have Kazuma, a lucky bastard with many cute girls in his party, the guy with weakest job (adventurer) in party but have many useful skill to mocking your enemy or your party mate. Aqua, the selfish goddess, with almighty job as Arch Priest, but choose a party skill to entertain other people. Megumin, the chuuni girl with Arch Wizard's job, can have many magic arsenal but choose to stay to the only one, the destructive magic, Explosion. Darkness, the masochist tanker, fit with her job as crusader with a strong defence, unfortunately, she can't hit opponent. The misfit party that sounds so fun, what make this anime so enjoyable to watch.


Enjoyment (10/10)


I can't stop laugh to watch this anime. I repeat it like 100 times and it still so fun to watch. I think no anime this year can repeat this performance (just my opinion). Watch it with more people and laugh it off your room.


Overall (9/10)


Despite the art, this anime was so great. It was simple but so fun to watch. I can't wait to watch the 2nd season next year. I hope it become more fun and the art will be good.

Had to give this series a go considering how many people recommended it to me and because it was pretty big in 2016. Well, it didn't quite hit the spot for me. 
The first episode was funny because it subverted expectations. It started out strong and promising but became more and more boring as it progressed. Most of the segments and jokes weren't funny, or maybe my intelligence is low and I don't get the humor. I laughed maybe 4-5 times during the whole show and I guess it's better than nothing. The rest was just forced comedy and same old jokes over and overagain. But it's definitely more funny than Nichijou and that's something. 


Animation is really good in some segments, especially during Megumin's explosions. The OP is also very well animated. Backgrounds look beautiful and the character designs are solid. Megumin's design is definitely the best. But they used CGI for Destroyer (and maybe some other things which I can't remember) and CGI is always a no-no in my book.


Soundtrack is not bad but nothing particular caught my ear and there was no melody which got stuck in my head. The OP and ED were generic and uninteresting.


Story is non-existent and there's no character development but considering the nature of this anime that's not a huge disadvantage. I understand that it parodies RPG and MMO elements but they could've come up with a better story while doing so. This anime just doesn't go anywhere. 


Konosuba had potential and, in my opinion, needed a lot more work. This is not a terrible anime per se. It has some good bits but loses it's fire pretty quickly. They should've just called it "Goofing Off In This Wonderful World".

Konosuba is by all intents and purposes a comedy anime, Because of this there isn't too much to talk about other than the comedy itself as that is pretty much the sole focus of the show. 
I think for a lot of people the comedy/humour will be hit or miss, i personally found it hilarious and the show does a good job of putting different types of humour on the table. 
The story is only there to put the characters into funny/awkward positions which depending on if you like the comedy or not can be good or bad.  
The four main characters: Kazuma,Megumin,Aqua andDarkness are all very wacky and fun and constantly get into hilarious circumstances and arguments together but again its for the comedy.  


The animation is decent and the facial animations used are top notch, Also i need to talk about the voice actors as they do a marvellous job here, making every scene as funny as it can be with either their over the top or sarcastic tones it is truly perfect for the show.  


Everything Konosuba does is for the comedy and humour,If you don't find the show funny after watching a couple of episodes i would say give it a skip.  


If you are like me and love the humour and just the comedy genre in anime in general you will have a blast (or some will say an EXPLOSION!)  


Positives: 


Character personalities and voice actors fit the show perfectly.  


Humour/comedy is well done and try's to mix it up so everyone can have a laugh.  


Facial animations have never looked better in a comedy anime. 



Negatives: 


Story is kind of shoehorned in for the comedy. 


As its comedy focused if someone doesn't find the show funny there is nothing else that can really entertain here. 


Jokes can be a tad overused and repetitive.  



Overall thoughts: Konosuba is a comedy anime through and through but the thing about humour is that its subjective so some people will love it some wont. Other aspects are pushed aside for the comedy so don't expect much there. 


If you find the show hilarious you will most likely be giving it a 9 or 8 out of 10 if not most likely a 5 or 6 its just that type of show . 


Konosuba can be hit or miss but if its a hit then it can be a comedic masterpiece.   


Watch if your sense of humour allows.

KonoSuba is a full-blown fantasy comedy, that parodies RPGs and the "Isekai" genre that Sword Art Online popularized. It's pretty much purely non-serious, doesn't have much of an overall story (there is one, but it never goes anywhere) and most episodes are rather self-contained. But what it lacks in epic adventures, it more than enough makes it up with its great humor.
The main reason for that is its cast of likeable, quirky characters. They're not the most sympathetic bunch, the male main character is selfish, rude and quite perverted. His main companion is not much better, mainly distinguished by a more positive disposition. An over-specialized,to the point of near uselessness, mage and a fighter, that is incapable of hitting anything but is way too enthusiastic in her role as a tank, top off the adventurer party that could barely be any more ineffective. Most of the humor comes from their internal conflict and lack of ability that makes it tricky to fulfill quests. And even when they manage to succeed, despite themselves, they're not always better off afterwards.


The voice actors have a done particularly great job in bringing the characters to life. Particularly the voices of the four main characters are near-perfect and really embody them very well to the point it's hard to imagine them with any other ones. The music is done well too, although teh ending song, beautiful as it is, does not fit the series very well.


Being DEEN work, the visuals have quite a share of hiccups, but its not immediately noticeable and overall it looks really good. Some things are particularly well-done and a real pleasure to look at, like Megumin's ever-beloved explosion spell (especially good, since its lengthy and you'll see it relatively often).


Something that's not apparent at first is that KonoSuba is quite a bit raunchy. It's normally not too much, but there are several noticeable instances of fanservice (particularly bouncing breasts) and lewd humor, which might already turn off some people. One episode goes way, way farther, though, to the point of turning into an ecchi. People who dislike such anime are highly unlikely to enjoy that episode (of course, those who like such things will have probably even more fun with it).


It's not an understatement to say that KonoSuba is one of the best comedy anime I've ever seen. While it arguably doesn't do anything special, it does it extremely well. It doesn't take itself or anything serious and doesn't hold back when it sees an opportunity for a joke. The setup and parodistic elements make it particularly interesting for fans of MMORPGs, but it's humor is broad enough to be also interesting for anyone else.

We all know this show it's insanely popular and well loved for good reason. Isekai's are a well that has run dry and the industry thinks there still something actually good worth reaching. This is a breath of fresh air in the sub-genre and a damn good parody of the tropes and genres at that. I really like referring to this show as the "it's always sunny in Philadelphia" of anime cause its true. All of our main characters are not the greatest of people and are all assholes in their own ways. But they're all so lovable and funny that we can look pastit and laugh at their misfortune.

Konosuba is my most favorite anime of all time,  I've held off the review just never being able to find the words to show my appreciation.   However,  having watched the English dub released recently,  I have found a different set of words.   The dub sucks, why are dubs sucking?  I am thankful that more people are going to get to see the show,  but I also know its going to ruin the experience for them!  Ifyou watch Konosuba in the dub format and hate it; you get a free pass on taste this go round. BECAUSE:



            Konosuba is a brilliant parody of the most cliche Isekai you could imagine.  The protagonist is reincarnated in a fantasy world fighting monsters and demons with his useless goddess sidekick, and a whole cast of characters whose affinity for failure (or unexpected success) will have you rolling in laughter.  It truly is the journey with this fable,  as the destination is at times seemingly irrelevant, given the cast can struggle with just everyday life.   There's a lot of 1 step forward 2 steps back type situations,  and they are all written with an unmatched comedic genius.  When you finally reach the end of Konosuba season 1,  You only want more!!   ((unless its the dub,  then you want just want to forget))  


               The animation in Konosuba is like a dependable can of Campbell's soup.  It's not gonna blow your mind, but will be comfortable and familiar in quality.  The audio is crucial to Konosuba,  not only the dynamic sounds of the environment and action, but even the musical scores are just down right comforting as well as complimenting.


The characters were really sold by their Japanese voice actors.  The personality obtained from their acting created the image and archetype of those characters. Their performance sent the character list of Konosuba straight into my memory as individuals.  I have heavy beef with the English dub.   I am sure they are talented voice actors,  but the translation of those characters is total bust, and here is why



Kazuma:  Japanese:  Coy, sly,  Voice of Reason, Optimistic but realistic.

                 English:  Twerpy Derpy Doofus


Aqua Japanese:  Prissy, cocky, self absorbed, fragile, annoying to protoag 

           Englsih:      Frantically Annoying to Everyone.


Megumin Japanese:    Coy,  Schemy,  Overconfident,  comical, blunt

               English:     1/4 the self confidence, shaky,  not very humorous.


Darkness Japanese:  Almost a split personality between virtuous and pervy,

       English:  They got darkness right, but  shes to loud at the wrong times.



                 It's truly a difference of loving the show, and being annoyed by it.  I  fell in love with Konosuba the first time I viewed it,  yet I wish I could undo having watched the English dub. 


            The Griiiizzzzzzliiiiessst Ziff of Kingsbeard gives the raw & sub format a personally biased 10/10

 (( when it probably measures a proper 9 over the  visuals))


            The ginger beardicus of anime viewership is also going leave a WELL DESERVED 3 for the dub format.   The audio of the characters  sold to me by the dub were not lovable. I did not enjoy it and while the story would still have been a great concept; Konosuba would have failed to impact me even as a parody.  It would be like someone who annoys you having a great idea. Despite the excellence of the idea, the caliber of the person telling you will have an effect on your opinion.  


         I still recommend watching it,  but you know.  In the raw or subbed format.  HIGHLY recommend.   THANKS FOR READING!

Konosuba is a very well praised anime. It is a hilarious anime (came in second for Best Comedy in the CrunchyRoll Anime Awards) that pokes fun at the "trapped in a video game world" anime genre. The highlight if the show are the 4 main characters, Kazuma, Aqua, Megumin and Darkness. 
Plot (No Spoilers)
Kazuma is a shut-in teenage boy who only leaves the house to go to school and buy video games. But, one day Kazuma sees a girl about to get hit by what he thinks is a truck. I won't talk anymore about how he dies, because it is absolutely hilarious and Idon't wanna ruin it for people. After he dies he is sent to the Afterlife and greeted by the goddess Aqua. Aqua is extremely rude to Kazuma, making fun of how he died and how he lived his life before his death. She says that she will send Kazuma to a RPG like world and gift him with one amazing weapon or skill of his choosing. Kazuma, being completely sick of Aqua's attitude, decides that he wants to take her with him to this world. Against Aqua's will, she and Kazuma are sent to the RPG world, with the mission of killing the Demon King. Along the way they might the crimson demon arch mage, Megumin and the crusader, Darkness.


Character Analysis


I'm gonna start off with the "goddess" Aqua. Aqua is a selfish narcissistic jerk, who is obsessed with party tricks and money. She is probably my least favorite character, but I still really like her. The anime knows how unlikable she is and uses that to make her the butt of most of the jokes. When she starts to get too full of herself the anime loves to put her in her place, whether its by getting completely shown up or by getting her butt whopped by a monster. She does have a few moments where she is likable.


Next is Megumin. Megumin is a young crimson demon who is an arch mage. Though there's only one problem with that. She only uses explosion magic. Which won't be a problem if it wasn't for the fact that using one explosion spell completely wears her out for the rest of the day. She can't move at all after using it. She refuses to learn any other type of magic, because explosion magic is the best and is her favorite. The scenes of Megumin using her explosion magic are always great. The animation for her charging her power and her dialogue while charging is almost always funny. And after a descrutive attack like that, seeing Megumin collapse to the ground is just really funny. She is completely over the top and I completely love it.


Darkness is probably my favorite out of the bunch. Mainly because she's the only kindhearted member of the party. Darkness is a crusader meaning she has high HP and Stamina. But there is one problem. She has awful accuracy! She can't even hit a stationary opponent! But Darkness is completely fine with that. Considering the fact that she is a masochist. She will run face first into danger, hoping she will get a beating. Even rude remarks makes her tremble. Though she is a kind person and a good knight that will always fight for others. 


If you couldn't tell, all three of these girls are completely insane for the most part. Constantly putting themselves and the whole party in danger due to their personalities. 


And poor Kazuma is stuck with them. Being stuck with these three turns Kazuma into a bigger jerk than Aqua. But Kazuma's attitude isn't all maloci. It's mostly just spite for the ggirls doing something to annoy him. He almost completely hates all three of them, though he does care for them somewhat. Kazuma is more move a thief like character. Though he can use weak magic as well as one undead skill. His main skill is "Steal" which lets him take one item from his target, though most of the time it's their underwear. Kazuma is a jerk because all of his hopes and dreams in this fantasy world are completely crushed almost as soon as he gets there.


Art and Sound


The art in this show is completely beautiful! Just about every single character, including side characters, have one color that always associates with them. Kazuma is Green, Aqua is Blue, Megumin is Red and Darkness is Yellow. The world that they are in is also beautiful as well. And the few fights we get are as good looking as they are funny, which is a lot! Though I do have some issues with the annoying fan service the show constantly has. Heck there's basically a whole episode dedicated to fan service and nothing more than that. The fan service is basically in every single episode, oh and apparently there are no bras in this fantasy world either. While I don't mind the perverted jokes the show makes all the time, the fan service is just a bother. Besides those complaints, the art is great!


I absolutely love the voice acting in this show. Even though I don't speak Japanese I still have got to hand it down to these voice actors, they completely nailed these roles. Giving the perfect delivery for every single joke this show has. Though I did find the soundtrack to get a little old since it was just same old tracks used over and over again.


The OP and ED are nice as well. Nothing really to rave about though. My favorite of the two is the energetic OP, while the ED is more of a Folk Song. 


Complainants 


Besides the fan service I only have a few complainants. 


The first being the lack of character development for Darkness, and Megumin to a lesser extent. We just don't get to know very much about them after our initial introduction to them. I would like to know more about their past. Megumin does get slight character development, but hardly enough. And Darkness doesn't get any till the last episode. Though it does seem that they are continuing to give Darkness more development in Season 2, I hope they do the same for Megumin.


The only other complaint is how the groups main quest to kill ht e Demon King is but to a hault by so many different things. The show doesn't really have a story except for a few episodes where some plot does happen.


Conclusion


I absolutely loved Konosuba! It was complete blast through out the whole thing. Despite a few issues I had, I found myself laughing through every episode (except the fan service episode). If you haven't watched Konosuba yet, now is the perfect time! Since Season 2 just recently started. There are only 10 episodes in Season 1 so it won't take you long to catch up. I give Konosuba an 8/10

Konosuba is a modern masterpiece in the comedy genre of anime. Period.
Probably the most genuine and funny anime that I have ever watched. Easily the first time I have genuinely laughed and enjoyed my self so much watching a show.  That goes for every single piece of content that is released for the series. Even reading the light novels and the manga, whether it be a spinoff or not, it is such an enjoyable experience. The character are genuine and have very distinct personalities that you get involved in so fast. Truly a master piece in the comedy genre.

I started watching this anime directly after watching all three seasons of Overlord. Needless to say my mindset for this anime was completely off. If you're expecting loads of action, a serious plot, or over the top spells and attacks this is the wrong anime. Now back to Kono Subarashii the story starts off with a otaku with no life, all he lived for was games. After some events he gets the chance to live in a parallel earth filled with magic like a rpg game.
Positives: Loaded with jokes and adult sexual themes, solid characters that come to life after a couple episodes, and ashow that just makes you want more and more.


Negatives: Lack of action, slow plot filled with adventures, and no real display of skills learned. We don't see any real progression.


I would recommend this show.

Have you ever experienced like seeing an ugly food but it turned to be so delicious? 
The sentence above is pretty much what i felt after watching Konosuba or Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!. From the first we're already served with bad art but as the show goes on, this anime turned into one of the most entertaining anime in winter season 2016.
Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo story is pretty much following the trend with a MC is being trapped in fantasy world. The MC, Kazuma thinks that he can be a hero and defeat the dark lords in that world like anyanime and game that he ever played but reality smash him hard. With such useless companions and no talents, Kazuma must struggling his life in the Fantasy world.


Yes, the premise that i said above maybe sound so stupid but its pretty much tells what this anime about. If you're looking for action and intense fight like any adventure action anime would be then this anime is not what you're looking for. Like premise said, Konosuba is mainly focus on the struggling Kazuma to live in fantasy world. You wouldnt find any fight scenes in this anime but you will find so many funny tsukkomi jokes. The jokes is really spot on and easily to understand, i really laugh my ass of when i watch this anime. The jokes in konosuba is mainly what makes this anime so great.


Not only the jokes, what makes the jokes is funnier is the seiyuu. They are perfectly fit with every characters's trait in this anime like Aqua with his stupid and airhead personality are voiced by Sora Amamiya, she is really nailed Aqua's voice. and also, Kazuma who voiced by Jun Fukushima is really great to be the tsukkomi for every jokes that appears in this anime. 


Another things to be worth to be mention is the characters, they are so original. like did you ever imagine Defender or tanker which have M personality? Yes, Konosuba have that, her name is Darkness. Your rotten type girl who is always get horny by getting attacked. I mean, thats perfect combination, right? tanker with M personality. Thats purely amazing. Not only Tanker, did u ever imagine Great mage that can only cast one destruction magic per day? yes, her name is Megumin. or maybe skillful priest but have airhead personality and pretty much idiot? thats just so brilliant. Every characters in this anime have their own uniqueness and make them as a valuable characters not only as side characters.


There is not much complain for every aspects in this anime except the art parts. The characters design looks so sloopy and sometimes makes such a weird pose and anatomy. The background is so-so but there is time like when they put an effort in the art especially when it comes to magic circle. It looks detailed and great. Anyway the lackness in art section maybe makes this anime not perfect but somehow for me, this lackness is really suitable with this kind of anime.


Last, i dont know how to say this about this anime. If i can describe this anime in one sentence it would be "stupidly funny". In every episode, i always laughed so hard. There is not much anime that makes me laugh so hard like this anime. So yeah, i would definitely recommend this anime if you're into comedy anime. Looking forward to the second season thou!

Note: This review may contain spoilers!
Story: 7/10 - The story and scenery of the anime reminds me of Runescape. It makes me think they are either in Lumbridge or Tutorial Island. They get to take on really cool quests and receive rewards that can help them survive. There's not a lot of plot development (yet), but I have a feeling that there is more to come in the future.
Characters: 7/10 - I always feel bad for Kazuma, especially when he has to deal with Aqua x). Aqua can be annoying but powerful, (DARKNESS) aka Raratina can be pervy but she's brave & Megumin is socute, powerful but needs to work on her endurance after using her powers. But as a team, they can unstoppable.\n\n
Enjoyment: 9/10 - There's a lot funny moments in the anime. (I.e.: Their teamwork on quests). This anime also reminds me of Hai To Gensou No Grimgar. While Konosuba is very funny during their quests, Hai To Gensou No Grimgar has more plot development and explores the backstories of some of the characters. \n\n
Overall: 8/10 - I definitely recommend it! It is definitely one of the animes that you MUST WATCH! It's filled comedic moments and senses of frustration at times that makes you want to cringe. In Konosuba, you get to know the characters and overtime, you get to see the dynamic when they work as a team while battling monsters and villains. You won't regret it. Plus, I can't wait for season 2.

Konosuba.
Imagine you're a regular high school kid with literally nothing abnormal. Just a normal otaku with no problems except getting laid by a chick before you turn 30 and become a wizard.
Then you're thrown into this world where there's demons, dragons, hot water goddess waifus with really shit water powers.
Okay, the second one may or may not be unique. However, the first paragraph and some of the second paragraph is the basic fantasy plot of every generic anime ever.
However, Konosuba is when you put a protagonist with a really, REALLY bland personality with actual somewhat cute waifu materials, and it somehow works out a littlebit.


Plot 0/ 10

There's literally no plot in this anime whatsoever, apart from there's a fire "giant" loli, a masochist warrior, and a dumbass water goddess following a Mary Sue- like character. Also all of them, aside from being really scrawny for adventurers, are all broke (also there's something about demon king, but everyone just ignores that lol).


Art and Sound 6/10

Normal, not weird art, for the moe fans out there.



Characters 10/10

Megumin. Just Megumin. EXPLOOOOOOOOSION!

#fireloli #onehitgirl #onlyviablewaifuintheshow


Enjoyment 10/10

No BS, I like it


Overall 8/10

Overall, the Characters I really enjoyed, but I really wished there were at least a little bit more focus on the art and music, as it sometimes turns me off.

With more than 8/10 on MAL, needless to say I got into Kono Suba with high expectations and while I understand why it's rated so high, I can't deny that it was kind of a let down.
One thing I'll have to concede to the show is that it doesn't waste time with any stretched out premises, it gets right to the point really fast and immediately sets the tone. Indeed, you won't need much time to figure that this show doesn't take itself seriously and has little to no restraint with the comedy it offers. And that's the main force of this anime, the comedyis always extremely exagerrated but never feels stretched or forced. Fast premise, cut to the chase and jump right into the action, good comedy, Kono Suba sets off with an extremely good start ! 


But that's it... You start the show with a very good impression but after a few episodes you realise that it's never taking off. The comedy stays good, the interactions between characters keep sailing at a steady pace, but...that's it. The story barely progresses, the characters don't gain any depth, what was supposed to be a fast premise turns out to be a rushed one since we never get to know more about the MC or the other characters but...he's a dude. In the last episodes, there's somewhat of a background that's taking shape with Darkness but it stays very surface level and sadly very generic. 


Ultimately, I can't help but feel that the show fails at clearly introducing itself as a show that's mostly focused on comedy. I think it would have gained from clearly setting itself as an episodic show, that would have prevented the viewer from expecting any major progress in the story or the character development.

I'll finish on a good note by saying that the art, animation and music are all top notch even though i'll regret the forced booby fanservice.


At the end of the day, Kono Suba stays a pretty enjoyable experience as long as you clearly understand what you're getting into : a show that doesn't take itself seriously no less, but no more.

This is the best comedy anime I've ever seen, and I've seen quite a bit of anime in my day. 
The best part of this show by far is the characters. You've just gotta love these clueless idiots. They take all the typical Isekai tropes and flip them on their heads. The MC, Kazuma, instead of being an overpowered cool guy, is an expectant jerk who thinks things will always go his way and is a bit of a perv. He then meets Aqua, who you'd expect to be the majestic love interest, is an entitled, whiny, stupid little idiot who party's and drinks allthe time, then begs her party members for money. Megumin is the cute little sister archetype, but along with that is a childish brat. The last of the MC's is Darkness, who appears to be the calm-and-collected, self-sacrificial, older sister type. But why would someone in a world as cruel as Konosuba be so willing to risk her life for others? Well, as it turns out, those 'selfless acts of heroism' are driven by very selfish masochism. In fact, she often risks her life and the lives of her party members just to satisfy her masochism.


Just reading this part of the jerk, the brat, the meme wizard, and the weirdo, you'd think you'd hate all tease characters, right? Well, the show somehow does the complete opposite. You've just gotta love these wonderful idiots. Especially the #BestWorstGirls

KonoSuba is an anime that I entered with mixed expectations. What I got kind of shocked me, and for the better. I'm not sure if this counts as plagiarism or not, but I am going to copy the format of the other guy that gave this anime a low score since I kind of like it. I won't copy the guy word by word, but simply the font style and ratings that they used. All words used in this font are mine and mine alone.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
WRITING: 5/10
I do admit that the writing for this anime is rather lackluster at times, but honestly, I admire a lotat  how much it fought generic anime cliché unlike anything I've ever watched before, such as one of the most generic tropes of a character always saying the other character's name. Whenever his name was spoken, Kazuma would go "Yes?" or acknowledge it every, single, time. And I thought that was hilarious for some reason. Speaking of, I admire his quirks throughout. He has small commentary during the female rant sequences that make them very enjoyable and his very essence brought so much life to most of the scenes. Very rare for a character to do that.


Though, sadly, this is where the positives end. One thing I did not like was that, near the end, it started to slowly migrate over to the generic "male character gets boned" shtick where Kazuma inevitably suffered the most out of any of his other allies. I think this correlates with how Japan sees women to men, so the male characters normally get screwed all of the time. And I don't mean sex. Kazuma really suffered a lot near the end, but I admire his charisma in that he didn't really become a sad sack and was also not afraid to speak up for himself. However, as good as his charisma was, he was not able to fight all of the cliché, but he did tackle the more annoying ones.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

ARTWORK: 6/10


The art in this anime is quite gorgeous, but maybe that's also because I am not used to the people that animated this. The way the mouths look during the comedy scenes, the eye design and more feel unfamiliar to me, as though I genuinely haven't seen such a style before. And this certainly applies to more than just design, cause eye-catches come quite a bit as well. I loved how they did certain comedy scenes as well and, overall, the style is simple, yet gentle. It's a nice flow that fits the (mostly) lighthearted nature of the whole thing.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK: 5/10


I have such a moderate score here cause, well most anime normally have memorable OSTs to me, this one kind of fell flat. I really loved the ending song and how well it conveyed the calm situation of the town, with everyone walking around, some of the allies trying to do basic tasks and some of them being appreciated by the townspeople. It just brought forth a very pleasant atmosphere that I really liked and I could really see myself coming back to it. Not just to listen, however, but to also watch. Cause, well the song is peaceful, I feel listening to it without watching doesn't bring forth that same experience. And I find that kind of sad, but also nice at the same time.


Aside from that, however, the soundtrack you hear in the anime itself is rather bland. With the exception of a certain sad piano song that plays during the more serious scenes, which I thought sounded very lovely, most of it sounds pretty generic. Perhaps, the opera theme that plays almost exclusively for Megumin is pretty comical since it can take the comedy and shift it into a state of seriousness at the most bizarre of times, but I sadly can't see myself remembering it. If I can find it at all, I'd probably want to add the piano song to my anime song playlist. But, everything else is pretty forgettable and, despite finishing today, I've already forgotten most of it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT: 6/10


This score is honestly so high cause, again, Kazuma. He alone gives this score a really high rating cause, really, he just fought all of that cliché as I said earlier. there's not much more to be said about how funny he is.


However, the main female ally of his was quite obnoxious. I didn't mind her personality so much, since I thought it was hilarious how she would slide from cocky to pitiful. I simply disliked how, despite her being the one to blame for a good amount of the damage caused to the town at times, Kazuma was still the one responsible for paying for it. She did have her own debts at first early on, but eventually, Kazuma became the scapegoat and that bugged me. And, honestly, some of the other allies felt a bit bland and had one-sided personalities, although I've taken quite a liking to Megumin due to her exotic nature. Definitely the highlight of the females.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

OVERALL: 7/10


This anime will make you laugh and that's just about all it is trying to do. The animation is peaceful and fits the atmosphere, the soundtrack can be pretty good at times (I actually do like the theme that plays before a quest starts cause it sounds so epic and like you are in an actual video game) and I will, unarguably, say that it is miles better than Sword Art Online, which had very peculiar pacing and a lot more that, well, would take up tons of paragraphs in that certain review to go over.


But, KonoSuba is not something I would recommend to just anyone. One thing I never mentioned is that it gets rather sexual near the end, even having what I would almost call a scene ripped right from a hentai in one of them, but you can just watch that for yourself to judge. The sexual nature doesn't take away from it, but it is rather peculiar that it is not listed under "ecchi" at all, despite the aforementioned episode I brought up. And I feel I had to mention it since, again, it is not listed under that genre for whatever reason, so you deserve a proper warning before you dive in. It also has moderate sexual humor all around, but the central story will still be intact and it's not too bad to watch.


However, if you really don't like that kind of stuff, I would go so far as to say you shouldn't be watching KonoSuba at all, cause it has quite a bit of that stuff in there later down the road, despite how innocently it starts off. If you have a high tolerance for it, or even enjoy it, then by all means watch this and you will not regret it.

I gotta start this review by saying I love memes. There's a lot that can be done with absurdist referential humor that strikes me as incredibly clever or inspired. When I say something has memes, or is a meme, know that it's not an insult, it comes from a place of appreciation. 
Konosuba is a show with incredible meme potential, which is how I was first introduced to it. A lot about the show's set up is really clever and subversive, to the extent that it would be silly to try to list everything. It starts off blowing back expectations when the protagonist dies apathetic death and is made fun of by a goddess, and everything spirals out from there. 


This is probably the aspect of the show I would praise the most. There are also a good number of clever moment-to-moment jokes that had me chuckling. However, the show didn't really have much for me beyond that. My favorite comedy series, stuff like D-Frag! and Cromartie High School, have similarly clever set-ups, a lot of hilarious situations, but also more wordplay and understated humor, arguably more developed characters, and most importantly are more consistently surprising. Konosuba's characters all have an obvious "thing" to them, a core element to their personality, and I didn't really see much past that. Despite the narrative subversions, this lent a certain element of predictability to how some of the comedy played out that definitely diminished the appeal for me. There are certainly charming and funny moments, but there were also some that I found somewhat dull, and as the show went on I was surprised less and less often.


A lot of this is subjective, of course; comedy is perhaps more than most other genres. But I didn't like Konosuba as much as I was hoping to, based on the premise; it was reasonably enjoyable but in my view rarely inspired beyond the initial set up. 6/10.

The comedy was enjoyable, and the characters were likable. But the way the story was structured was  a little bit awkward. Everything In Konosuba revolved around into trying to turn everything into comedy. And the problem with this is it just killed any sort of drama or action in the story. Which was very unusual because you can tell that the writer was trying to make these dramatic scenes But then instead of making them dramatic they just turned a big scary enemy attacking the city, into a joke that you couldn't even take seriously. All the main characters in thisseries had very exaggerated personalities. To be honest it feels like the writer turned each main character into a running gag based on their abilities. (for example Megumin is the girl who loves explosions but can only cast one giant spell each day). It's still an enjoyable series to watch, but the only really enjoyable aspect of this anime was the comedy.

I cant quite put it in words, I love konosuba
 It an awesome anime and has a lot of potencial.
Comedy RPG has quite unexpected fresh feel to it.
I giving it score 9/10
can't wait for second season to come out.

That's probably why first episode had me hooked and wanting to see more and more.
My only complaint is that it's only 10 episodes long maybe that is what makes itgreat and not a drag.\n\n
Art is great but I cant quite compare as I was watching on 8"inch 720p tablet.\n\n
Characters are all interesting especially when they end up in embarrassing situations and makes you wonder how far will they go.\n\n
